2022-10-14 Riddler Classic
==========================
If there are $n$ people in the room with $n$ distinct birthdays,
let $N(n)$ be the expected number of people in the room when they eat cake.

$$ N(n) = n(n+1)/365 + (365-n)N(n+1)/365 $$

$$ N(365) = 366 $$

Using [code](20221014c.hs), $N(0) =  \approx 24.616585894598852$.

Extra credit
------------
If there are $n$ people with $m$ distinct birthdays, and $n-m$ days for
which two people have birthdays,
let $N(n,m)$ be the expected number of people in the room when they eat cake.

There are $2m-n$ days for which one person in the room has a birthday.

$$ N(n,m) = (n-m)(n+1)/365 + (2m-n)N(n+1,m)/365 + (365-m)N(n+1,m+1)/365 $$

$$ N(365,365) = 731 $$

Using [code](20221014c.hs), $N(0,0) =  \approx 88.7389176506049$.
